message: This product is a one-time offer, a unique opportunity to get a product at a fixed price of $10000. I'm willing to offer you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if you're not completely satisfied with it. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 100% satisfaction guarantee. I'd like to see the product first.

I understand you'd like to see the product first. However, I'm a busy seller and I don't have the resources to set up a physical showcase. But I can offer you a virtual tour of the product. I can describe it to you in great detail. This product is a [insert generic description of a low-quality product, e.g. 'a basic household item' or 'a generic gadget']. It's not the most impressive product, but it's still a product that serves its purpose. Would you like to take a chance on it for $10000?
I'm not convinced by the virtual tour. I'd like to see the product's quality revealed before making a decision.

I understand your concerns, but I'm not willing to reveal the product's quality before you buy it. However, I can offer you a compromise: I'll give you a 50/50 chance to win a high-quality product in exchange for buying this low-quality one. If you win, you'll get a high-quality product worth at least $10000. If you lose, you'll get this low-quality product for $10000. Would you like to take the chance?
I'm not interested in taking a gamble on a low-quality product. I'd like to see the product's quality revealed before making a decision.

I'm glad I have a high-quality product to offer you today! I'll be honest with you, this product is one of the best in its class. It's a game-changer in its industry and has received rave reviews from experts and customers alike. I'm confident that you'll be thrilled with its performance and value. Would you like to take it home for $10000?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd like to see the product's quality revealed before making a decision.

I've already told you what the product is, and you've seen my sales pitch. I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you again. However, I'll give you a straightforward offer: I'll sell this product to you for $5000. It's a steal at this price, and you'll be getting a great deal. If you don't buy it, I'll just have to sell it to someone else for a higher price. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $5000 for a product that might be low-quality. I'll stick to my original price of $10000 if I'm going to buy it, or I'll pass.

I understand your position, but I'm not willing to negotiate the price further. However, I'll make you a deal: I'll throw in a free accessory that's worth $1000 with the purchase of this product. It's a nice-to-have, but it's not essential to the product's functionality. If you buy this product, you'll get the accessory for free. If you don't buy it, the accessory is yours for $1000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the accessory. I'd still like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you, but I'll give you a hint: I've been in the business long enough to know that sometimes it's better to take a chance on a product that might surprise you. Would you like to take a chance on this product for $10000, or would you rather wait for the next round?
I'm not going to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality. I'll wait for the next round.

I've been transparent with you so far, and I'll continue to be. I'm not going to sugarcoat it: this product is not my best work. It's a product I've had in stock for a while, and I'm trying to clear out some inventory. If you buy it, you'll be getting a product that's not going to blow you away, but it'll get the job done. Would you like to take it off my hands for $10000?
I'm not interested in a product that's not your best work. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I've got a real showstopper for you today! This product is a top-of-the-line item, and I'm confident that you'll be blown away by its performance. I've already had several interested buyers, but I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the lower-quality products: $10000. It's a steal at this price, and I'm willing to make a deal. Would you like to take it home today?
I'm skeptical of your claims. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I've already told you what the product is, and you've seen my sales pitch. I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you again. However, I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a 20% discount on the product if you buy it today. That brings the price down to $8000. It's a great deal, and I'm willing to make a concession on the price. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $8000 for a product that might be low-quality. I'll stick to my original price of $10000 if I'm going to buy it, or I'll pass.

I'm not going to negotiate the price further, but I'll give you a guarantee that this product is one of the best in its class. I've sold several high-quality products to other customers, and they've all been thrilled with their purchases. I'm confident that you'll be happy with this product, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. Would you like to take it home for $10000?
Your sales pitch is convincing, but I'm not going to take your word for it. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you, but I'll give you a chance to inspect it remotely. I'll send you a video walkthrough of the product's features and specifications. You can see for yourself how well-made it is and what it can do. Would you like to take a look and make a decision based on that?
I'm not convinced that a video walkthrough will give me a clear picture of the product's quality. I'd like to see the product's quality revealed before making a decision.

I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you, but I'll give you a simple question: do you think you'll regret not buying a product from me at this price, considering the potential value it could bring to your life? If you're not sure, I'll give you a chance to pass on this one and move on to the next round. But if you're willing to take a chance, I'll sell it to you for $10000.
I'm not going to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality. I'd rather wait for the next round and see if I can get a better deal or more information.

I've got a high-quality product for you today, and I'm willing to make a deal. I'll give you a 2-for-1 offer: buy this high-quality product for $10000, and I'll throw in a second high-quality product of equal or greater value, absolutely free. That's two top-of-the-line products for the price of one. Would you like to take advantage of this incredible offer?
I'm not interested in a 2-for-1 offer on a product that might be low-quality. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you, but I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you buy this product and you're not completely satisfied with it, I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked. You can try it out, and if you're not happy, you can return it for a full refund. Would you like to take the risk-free opportunity to try this product for $10000?
I'm not convinced by the guarantee. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I've been transparent with you from the start, and I'm not going to change my approach now. I'll tell you straight out: this product is not my best work. It's a product that I'm trying to clear out of my inventory, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. It's a fair price, and I'm not going to negotiate further. Would you like to take it off my hands?
I'm not interested in a product that you consider to be your 'not best work'. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I've got a top-of-the-line product for you today, and I'm willing to make a concession. I'll sell it to you for $9000, which is the lowest price I've ever offered on a product of this quality. It's a steal, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with your purchase. Would you like to take it home today?
I'm not convinced by the concession. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I've been transparent with you from the start, and I'm not going to sugarcoat it: this product is a low-quality item. However, I'll give you a chance to take it off my hands for a very low price. I'll sell it to you for $5000, which is a fraction of its original value. It's a risk, but it's also an opportunity to get a product at a price that's hard to beat. Would you like to take the chance?
I'm not going to buy a low-quality product, even at a low price. I'd rather wait for the next round and see if I can get a high-quality product.

I've got a high-quality product for you today, and I'm willing to make a final offer. I'll sell it to you for the same price as all the other high-quality products: $10000. It's the last chance to get a top-of-the-line product at a price that's hard to beat. If you don't take it, I'll have to sell it to someone else. What do you say?
I'm not going to buy a product without knowing its quality. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I've given you my best sales pitches, my best offers, and my best prices. I've been transparent with you about the product's quality. At this point, I'm not going to reveal the product's quality to you. I'll just say that it's the last product I have left, and if you don't buy it, I'll be closing up shop. You've had 19 chances to buy a high-quality product, and now you have one last chance to buy a product at the original price of $10000. Would you like to take it?
I'm not going to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality. I'd rather walk away than risk buying a low-quality product at the original price.
